00005 def peaks(*args):
00006     n = 49
00007     nargs = len(args)
00008     if nargs in (0,1):
00009         if nargs == 1:
00010             n = int(args[0])
00011         x, y = meshgrid(seq(n),seq(n))
00012     elif nargs == 2:
00013         x, y = args
00014     else:
00015         raise ValueError, "peaks: wrong number of arguments"
00016     z = 3*(1-x)**2*exp(-x**2 - (y+1)**2) \
00017         - 10*(x/5 - x**3 - y**5)*exp(-x**2-y**2) \
00018         - 1/3*exp(-(x+1)**2 - y**2)
00019     return z

00021 def gradient(f,*varargs):
00022     """Written by Travis Oliphant?
00023     (http://aspn.activestate.com/ASPN/Mail/Message/scipy-user/2761129)
00024     """
00025 
00026     N = len(f.shape)  # number of dimensions
00027     n = len(varargs)
00028     if n==0:
00029         dx = [1.0]*N
00030     elif n==1:
00031         dx = [varargs[0]]*N
00032     elif n==N:
00033         dx = list(varargs)
00034     else:
00035         raise SyntaxError, "Invalid number of arguments"
00036 
00037     # use central differences on interior and first differences on endpoints
00038 
00039     outvals = []
00040 
00041     # create slice objects --- initially all are [:,:,...,:]
00042     slices = [None]*3
00043     for k in range(3):
00044         slices[k] = []
00045         for j in range(N):
00046             slices[k].append(slice(None))
00047 
00048     for axis in range(N):
00049         # select out appropriate parts for this dimension
00050         out = zeros(f.shape, f.dtype)
00051         slices[0][axis] = slice(1,-1)
00052         slices[1][axis] = slice(2,None)
00053         slices[2][axis] = slice(None,-2)
00054         # 1d equivalent -- out[1:-1] = (f[2:] - f[:-2])/2.0
00055         out[slices[0]] = (f[slices[1]] - f[slices[2]])/2.0   
00056         slices[0][axis] = 0
00057         slices[1][axis] = 1
00058         slices[2][axis] = 0
00059         # 1d equivalent -- out[0] = (f[1] - f[0])
00060         out[slices[0]] = (f[slices[1]] - f[slices[2]])
00061         slices[0][axis] = -1
00062         slices[1][axis] = -1
00063         slices[2][axis] = -2
00064         # 1d equivalent -- out[-1] = (f[-1] - f[-2])
00065         out[slices[0]] = (f[slices[1]] - f[slices[2]])
00066         
00067         # divide by step function
00068         outvals.append(out / dx[axis])
00069         
00070         # reset the slice object in this dimension to ":"
00071         slices[0][axis] = slice(None)
00072         slices[1][axis] = slice(None)
00073         slices[2][axis] = slice(None)
00074 
00075     if N == 1:
00076         return outvals[0]
00077     else:
00078         return outvals

00080 from graphics.numpytools import arctan2, sqrt, shape, log, sin, cos
00081 
00082 def cart2sph(xx, yy, zz):
00083     # theta, phi, r = cart2sph(xx, yy, zz)
00084     theta = arctan2(yy, xx)
00085     phi = arctan2(zz, sqrt(xx**2 + yy**2))
00086     r = sqrt(xx**2 + yy**2 + zz**2)
00087     return theta, phi, r
00088 
00089 def sph2cart(theta, phi, r):
00090     # xx, yy, zz = sph2cart(theta, phi, r)
00091     xx = r * cos(phi) * cos(theta)
00092     yy = r * cos(phi) * sin(theta)
00093     zz = r * sin(phi)
00094     return xx, yy, zz
00095 
00096 def flow(xx, yy, zz):
00097     # xx,yy,zz,vv = flow(xx,yy,zz)
00098     
00099     # Convert to spherical coordinates (with xx as the axis).
00100     A = 2; nu = 1
00101 
00102     th,phi,r = cart2sph(yy,zz,xx)
00103     vr = 2*nu/r*((A**2-1)/(A-cos(phi))**2 - 1)
00104     vphi = -2*nu*sin(phi)/(A-cos(phi))/r
00105     vth = zeros(shape(r))
00106 
00107     vx,vy,vz = sph2cart(vth,vphi,vr)
00108     vv = log(sqrt(vx**2 + vy**2 + vz**2))
00109 
00110     return xx, yy, zz, vv
